item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

@1. You solved already thanks to pwnd.

@2. We can use the following code to do this:

String content = ""; //Whatever is going to be saved into the text file
File f = new File(filename, filepath);
PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(f)));
out.write(content);
out.close();

@3. My suggestion for the file in general is to use the person’s username as the file name. That way you can do something like the following when the user logins in:

File saveDir = new File("./", "users");
if (!saveDir.exists()) { saveDir.mkdir(); } //if the save directory does not exist, make it
File f = new File(username + ".txt", "./users/");
if (!f.exists()) { //if the file does not exist, do the following
try { //The following code throws an IOException
PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(f))); //start a new PrintWriter for File f
out.write(content); //write the content string into File f
out.close(); //close the PrintWriter
} catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } //just in case we get an IOException
//otherwise if it does exist, do something else
}
